comment: Super helpful, although she doesn't post the powerpoints online, so you pretty much have to go to class. Has open office hours and emails out to students frequently. Very nice!

Dr. Freedman passed away on 6/29/07. He loved his subject and his students. I found his kindness, openness, creativity, and out-of-the-box style to be refreshing and inspiring. I am sad that he is not here, but when I remember Dr. Freedman, I smile and I know that life is full of possibilities!

One of the friendliest and sweetest professors on campus. His class is so easy and he's very accomodating to your needs.  He gives open book test on webct and they are very easy.  Only thing is, he grades on attendance. He makes the class intereting by getting the whole class involved in different activities.

You have 3 online exams,its from read the chapters.1 in class final,questions like what was you favorite part of the class.12 social logs webct,where you write about your life in a sociological point of view.2 individual movie reviews and 2 group ones.you have assign seats & attendance everyday.1 project you basically do anything with it.fun class.

Dr. Freedman is very passionate about his work, but I felt like I was back in high school. we had assigned seating, and attendance required. Everything is online:tests, soclogs. There was no reason to go to class- I wouldve rather taken it as an online course.
Easiest A I've ever received in my life. Nicest professor I've ever met. He doesn't believe in tests. I didn't do anything in his class and received an A- so I'm still confused to this point.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE. If you do you might as well just go ahead and give yourself an F and save the trouble. CONFUSING UNCLEAR HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. If someone should not be teaching online it is THIS PROFESSOR. Others may say im wrong but believe me this class is horrible.

He was extremely nice and helpful. I took the class online so I really was only around him a few times during the semester but he was so sweet. And, I had some problems with some of my work and he was more than happy to help me out. He was very flexible as far as going out of his way to help students.
I took his class and it was a breeze.  He made it fun and exciting!  At the end of our class, he asked us what we thought we deserved for our grades... I asked for what I wanted, and I got it!
Really Really Easy!  He is so nice and helpful!

I can't say enough great things about Dr. Freedman.  His lectures are very interesting and really promote thought.  He brings a lot of knowledge and experience to the table and encourages students to think critically about what they know about the world.  Take his class!

He changes his class every semester, so reading these don't apply.  He no longer gives essays, and he is very lax when it comes to due dates.  He is always willing to adapt his teaching style so that you get the best grade possible. Always gives plenty of extra credit, and easy to make an A.
Amazing and intelligent man - he has so much knowledge to offer students who actually give a darn about their education. KSU is lucky to have him on staff.

I really enjoyed his online class.  I learned more and was able to do it at my own pace.  He is very helpful if you attend the optional classes and he sees that you are actually trying to make an effort to understand his class.

No standard tests in this class.  The books are difficult, but the papers are not necessarily about the books.  He does a powerpoint presentation to show all of the soc. points that he makes.  Very likeable.
Very difficult to understand.  Not much teaching, lots of rambling.  A lot of paper writing on books no one understands.
